benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host out of rotation

covered: DELETE: Valid Deletion — TC01 demonstrates successful removal of host from rotation (HTTP 204, empty body).
Authorization — TC02 and TC03 verify 401 for missing/invalid authentication; TC13 checks header-based security leading to 400/401.
Conflict/Edge-case handling — TC04 (host already out) and TC14 (no hosts in rotation) test HTTP 409 for conflicting state or unavailability.
Endpoint availability — TC05 ensures HTTP 503 when the service is down or unreachable.
Server error handling — TC06 verifies HTTP 500 for internal errors during operation.
Method enforcement — TC07 validates HTTP 405 for invalid HTTP method usage (e.g., GET).
Query parameter handling — TC08 covers extra query parameters in the DELETE request.
Payload validation — TC09 ensures 400 for malicious or invalid request body.
Performance testing — TC10 (normal load) and TC11 (concurrent requests) verify response time and concurrency constraints.
Regression/state verification — TC12 confirms the host status persists as out of rotation and can be queried.
Security testing — TC13 tests injection attempts via headers to validate authentication/headers handling.
Edge-case coverage — TC14 ensures proper handling when no hosts are in rotation (409).
gaps: Rate limiting: no explicit throttling test (e.g., 429) under bursty loads beyond a basic concurrency test.
Non-existent resource: no explicit test for deleting a truly non-existent host distinct from the no-host edge case (404/409 depending on design).
Caching behavior: no tests for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) on DELETE responses; often not applicable but worth documenting if applicable to the API.
Content-Type/Accept edge cases: missing or invalid Content-Type in the request not covered.
Higher/concurrent load stress testing: additional tests with larger numbers of concurrent DELETE requests to further stress the endpoint.
recommendations: Add explicit rate-limiting tests to verify throttling behavior (429) under bursty conditions.
Introduce a dedicated non-existent resource test (e.g., a truly non-existent host) to confirm proper error handling (404/409 depending on design).
Document and test caching behavior for DELETE responses if applicable (ETag/Cache-Control), or explicitly state non-cached behavior if appropriate.
Add tests around Content-Type handling and missing body scenarios to ensure robust input validation.
Expand concurrency and load testing to simulate higher contention and longer-running DELETE operations to stress-test endpoint stability.
